Posts.Content: I got a call today about my mammogram and ultrasound and they told me all were normal. However I still have the huge lump in my left breast and its quite painful. The report said it is a palpalble mass but it isnt a cyst and it is benign. I still have the appointment with breast specialist in Jan--and I definitely am keeping that appointment. But could they actually say it isnt a problem-meaning not cancerous without doing a biopsy??Any help would be great. thanks in advance! they said they compared it with my last mammogram and there has been no change in my breasts.But this lump is definitely a change??
Posts.Title: i am so confused!!Any ideas???

Posts.Content: Great news!!The breast specialist says it is fibrocystic breasts and that I have dense tissue. Will re check in 3 months to just keep it in check. such a relief!!
Posts.Title: i am so confused!!Any ideas???

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for all the responses. You are a great group of people and a tremendous support while waiting to see drs and see what the next step is. I found out today from my GI dr that I have to have my gallbladder out and I also found out that the surgeon is also a breast surgeon. So I have an appt on this Friday for a consult and hopefully he can do a aspiration or the lump or biopsyof the breast in the office. Will keep you posted!
Posts.Title: i am so confused!!Any ideas???

Posts.Content: I should have posted and introduced myself before I posted to this board. But I was so surprised about my appt and wanted to get any information anyone may have asap. I am 44 and a stay at home mom to an almost 3 year old.Have had many a friends dealing with breast cancer and treatment. Just want some answers for anyone who can help. Thanks in advance!
Posts.Title: Is it true that cancerous lumps are not painful??

Posts.Content: So the actual topic of my post was are cancerous lumps usually painful when pressed on and such??If anyone has experience on something to share that would be great!
Posts.Title: Is it true that cancerous lumps are not painful??

Posts.Content: Well I got my appointment for my mammogram moved up to Dec 12th. So I guess being persistant paid off. Hope everyone has a wonderful holiday season.
Posts.Title: Is it true that cancerous lumps are not painful??

Posts.Content: Well I just got back from having my annual pap and they found a lump while doing the breast exam. The dr said not to worry because the more he tried to feel it- the more sore and painful it got. He said that cancerous lumps are not painful??Is that true?? The lump in rather lumpy too and has irregular borders. I couldnt get my mammogram scheduled til almost a month from now. So waiting to find out is hard and I was told not to worry- easier said then done. The interesting thing is then my drs office called and said they wanted me to see a breast specialist??So now I am wondering why that now?and the breast specialist cant see me til Jan!! Eeek! Anyways any information or experiences would be greatly appreciated! My aunt and great aunt had breast cancer but they were diagnosed in their 70's.
Posts.Title: Is it true that cancerous lumps are not painful??

Posts.Content: HI Cj, Thanks for the response. I did contact my drs office and they were like it is being addressed and so that was that. I was actually thinking of maybe trying to see someone else since I pretty much can do that on my own. The waiting will drive me nutso especially throughout the holidays. I am gonna call them on Monday again and try to be a little more persistant! Waiting two months is nuts.
Posts.Title: Is it true that cancerous lumps are not painful??
